pullRequest.body:
The centroid of a non-associative, non-unital algebra coincides with the centralizer of the left and right multiplication operators.

---

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: bors d+

:v: mans0954 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7124124067/job/19397872442)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7124124067/job/19397872124)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7124124067/job/19397872740)
Thanks! I think this needs a bit of work and another round of review afterwards.

I encourage you to try your hand at golfing (either your own proofs, or others). I think you may learn lots of ways to simplify your arguments. Golfing is not *always* desirable (sometimes it can be detrimental to proof readability), but I think my golfed proof is actually more readable because it boils it down to the key features.

One thing to pay attention to in particular: use `rcases` or `rintro`. These are your friend, *especially* with the `rfl` feature which does the automatic substitution for you.

`refine` is also nice because it can be used, as I did, to provide one piece of a `T, ?_, ?_` and leave the rest as goals.

Also, if you find yourself using lots of rewrite lemmas that are all definitional, maybe see if at the end you can avoid most of them.

This lemma looks like a bad idea to me, since it casts away the type synonym. I think you should stick with
```suggestion
lemma toEnd'_apply (f : CentroidHom ) : toEndRingHom  f = f.toEnd := rfl
```

why do you even need this lemma? `map_mul_left f` should Just Work(TM), and it's already `export`ed to the root namespace.
```suggestion
protected lemma map_mul_left (f : CentroidHom ) (a b : ) : f (a * b) = a * f b :=
```
This lemma is no longer needed, so I removed it.

same question
```suggestion
protected lemma map_mul_right (f : CentroidHom ) (a b : ) : f (a * b) = f a * b :=
```
This lemma is no longer needed, so I removed it.

typo?
```suggestion
def toEnd (f : CentroidHom ) : AddMonoid.End  :=
```

```suggestion
    CentroidHom  +* AddMonoid.End  where
```

```suggestion
/-- The canonical ring homomorphism from the centroid into the additive monoid
endomorphisms. This is `CentroidHom.toEnd` upgraded to a ring homomorphism. -/
```
why the prime? why not `toEnd_apply`? (or better: `toRingHomEnd_apply`.) And probably you can just get this with `@[simps]` on `toRingHomEnd`.

We now get this from:
```
@[simps]
def toEndRingHom : CentroidHom  +* AddMonoid.End  where
```
Why are you using `MonoidHom.mrange` and not `RingHom.rangeS` (and `Subsemiring.centralizer`)?
That would make more sense. Done, thanks.
This result is also in #8742
#8742 is on the queue, so this PR will need to merge master afterwards.
This has now been done.

```suggestion
```

:golfing:
```suggestion
  refine ?_, fun h  ?_
   rintro f, rfl S (a, rfl | b, rfl)
     exact AddMonoidHom.ext fun b  (map_mul_left f a b).symm
     exact AddMonoidHom.ext fun a  (map_mul_right f a b).symm
   rw [Subsemiring.mem_centralizer_iff] at h
    refine T, fun a b  ?_, fun a b  ?_, rfl
     exact congr($(h (L a) (.inl a, rfl)) b).symm
     exact congr($(h (R b) (.inr b, rfl)) a).symm
```

This lemma has `A` as an explicit argument. That's probably not what is intended.
```suggestion
lemma mul_apply (f g : AddMonoid.End A) (a : A) : (f * g) a = f (g a) := rfl
```
Did you mean to make a suggestion there?

I assume this would be:
```
lemma mul_apply {A} [AddZeroClass A] (f g : AddMonoid.End A) (a : A) : (f * g) a = f (g a) := rfl
```
However, with the latest golfing, this lemma is no longer required for this PR, so I've removed it.

I think the name of this lemma is a bit weird because `MulOpposite` is not explicitly involved. Maybe this instead?
```suggestion
lemma centroid_eq_centralizer_mulLeftRight :
```
`mul_op` was short for "Multiplication Operator".

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Ring/CentroidHom): The centroid is the centralizer of multiplication operators
